com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages
Class Message

java.lang.Object
  com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.Message
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinaryMessage, TextMessage, UnicodeMessage, USSDDisplayMessage, USSDPromptMessage, WapPushMessage
public abstract class Message
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Message.java

Created on 5 January 2011, 17:34

Represents the details of a message that is to be submitted via the http api.
Not instanciated directly, but instead via one of the sub-classes that represent a particular message type

Version:
1.0
Author:
Paul Cook
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary
static int MESSAGE_TYPE_BINARY
          Message ia a binary SMS message with a custom UDH and binary payload
static int MESSAGE_TYPE_TEXT
          Message ia a regular TEXT SMS message
static int MESSAGE_TYPE_UNICODE
          Message is a unicode message, for sending messages in non-latin script to a supported handset
static int MESSAGE_TYPE_USSD_DISPLAY
          Message is a USSD 'display' message that displays on handset but does not require a response
static int MESSAGE_TYPE_USSD_PROMPT
          Message is a USSD 'prompt' message that requires a response from the end user
static int MESSAGE_TYPE_WAPPUSH
          Message is a wap-push message to send a browsable / downloadable url to the handset

Method Detail

getType

public int getType()
Returns:
int the type of message will influence the makeup of the request we post to the Nexmo server, and also the action taken by the Nexmo server in response to this message

getFrom

public java.lang.String getFrom()
Returns:
String the 'from' address that will be seen on the handset when this message arrives, typically either a valid short-code / long code that can be replied to, or a short text description of the application sending the message (Max 11 chars)

getTo

public java.lang.String getTo()
Returns:
String the phone number of the handset that you wish to send the message to

getMessageBody

public java.lang.String getMessageBody()
Returns:
String The text of the message to be sent to the handset

getBinaryMessageBody

public byte[] getBinaryMessageBody()
Returns:
byte[] The raw binary message data to be sent to a handset. This api, and the Nexmo messaging service will send this data 'as-is' (in conjunction with the binary UDH) and will not make any corrections. so you should ensure that it is a correctly constructed message

getBinaryMessageUdh

public byte[] getBinaryMessageUdh()
Returns:
byte[] Most binary content will require a UserDataHeader portion of the message containing commands to enable the handset to interpret the binary data (for example, a binary ringtone, a wap-push, OverTheAir configuration, etc). Additionally, if you are sending a long text message as multiple concatenated messages and are performing this operation manually rather than using the automated long messaging handling in the Nexmo messaging service, then you will need to construct and include here an appropriate UserDataHeader field that describes the segmentation/re-assembly fields required to sucessfully concatenate multiple short messages.

getClientReference

public java.lang.String getClientReference()
Returns:
String This is a user definable reference that will be stored in the Nexmo messaging records. It will be available in detailed reporting / analytics In order to help with reconcilliation of messages

isUnicode

public boolean isUnicode()
Returns:
boolean This flag is set to true if the message needs to be submitted as a unicode message. This would be for scenario's where the message contains text that does not fit within the Latin GSM alphabet. Examples would be messages to be sent in non-western scripts, such as Arabic, Kanji, Chinese, etc.

getStatusReportRequired

public boolean getStatusReportRequired()
Returns:
boolean If set to true, then a delivery notification will be requested for this message delivery attempt. Upon receiving notification of delivery or failure from the network, the Nexmo platform will submit a notification to the url configured in your Nexmo REST account that represents the outcome of this message.

getWapPushUrl

public java.lang.String getWapPushUrl()
Returns:
String This is the url that will be submitted to the handset and will appear as a browsable message in the Inbox.

getWapPushTitle

public java.lang.String getWapPushTitle()
Returns:
String This is the title that will be associated with the url being submitted to the handset

getWapPushValidity

public int getWapPushValidity()
Returns:
int This is the length of time (in seconds) that the message will be available for once delivered to the handset. Once this time has expired, the url will no longer be visible on the handset to be browsed (Subject to handset compatibility)

getMessageClass

public MessageClass getMessageClass()
Returns:
com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.parameters.MessageClass The message class that is to be applied to this message.

getProtocolId

public java.lang.Integer getProtocolId()
Returns:
Integer The value of the GSM Protocol ID field to be submitted with this message. Ordinarily this should be left as the default value of 0
